Bleed Life.name: Bleed Life
Bleed Life.description:
You are intimately aware of how to manipulate the flows of life force within creatures, and can bleed off some of their vitality to empower your undead. The creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Drained]{Drained 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is drained 1 and takes [[/r 1d4[persistent,bleed]]] and your undead minion regains Hit Points each time the target creature takes damage from this bleed effect equal to the damage dealt.

Critical Failure As Failure, but the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Drained]{Drained 2} and takes [[/r 2d4[persistent,bleed]]].

Heightened (+2) The persistent bleed damage on a failure increases by 1d4 (or 2d4 on a critical failure).
Bleed Life.target: 1 living creature and 1 undead minion you control

Color Balance.name: Color Balance
Color Balance.description:
Your connection with the First World has given you two things – a level of power over some aspects of a forest's natural colors, and the fey propensity for bargaining.

Your target chooses either to Give or Take, and rolls 1d4 on the table below to determine the color and relevant effect. If they choose Give, they lose all perception of that color. If they choose Take, they take on an extreme perception of that color becoming oversaturated. If the target is targeted by color balance more than once in the same day by the same person, they must choose the other option of Give or Take than the previous time they were targeted.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and the duration of the effects is 1 round.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the duration of the effects is 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, and the duration of the effects is 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.impossible-lands.impossible-lands-tables.JPqGRVRkJyr2rGBB]{Color Balance: Give}

@UUID[Compendium.impossible-lands.impossible-lands-tables.bNaFZObHmjFm3e08]{Color Balance: Take}

Heightened (+1) The initial damage increases by 1 die, persistent damage by 1, and duration of conditions on a failure by 1 round.

Invert Lifeforce.name: Invert Lifeforce
Invert Lifeforce.description:
You reverse the flows of positive and negative energy within one creature making them be harmed instead of healed by positive energy, and healed instead of harmed by negative energy. If you cast this spell on a willing ally, the ally can choose which result it gets without rolling. The creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is affected until the end of your turn.

Failure The target is affected until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure As a failure, but instead the target is affected for the full duration.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to four creatures with this spell.

Magical Fumigation.name: Magical Fumigation
Magical Fumigation.description:
You've learned the ways of not only avoiding the poison clouds, but how to redirect them. The energies from your last spell remain, and you harness some of that energy to create a cloud of magical radiation. The cloud lasts a number of rounds equal to the level of the triggering spell and once per round you can move the cloud 15 feet as a single action with the concentrate trait. Creatures that begin their turn in the area or enter the area take 2d6 damage on a basic Reflex save. Creatures that fail their save are also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure. The damage is of a type depending on the school of the triggering spell.

  • Abjuration force damage
  • Conjuration or Transmutation poison damage
  • Divination, Enchantment, or Illusion mental damage
  • Evocation a type the spell dealt, or force damage if the spell didn't deal damage
  • Necromancy negative damage

Murky Miasma.name: Murky Miasma
Murky Miasma.description:
Your mere footsteps summon a miasma from the Mana Wastes. The @Template[emanation|distance:5] around you becomes hazardous terrain. A creature that enters your miasma or begins its turn in your miasma takes @Damage[1d4[mental]] on a basic Will save. Creatures that fail their save become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Dazzled]{Dazzled} as long as they remain in the area. Each time you Sustain this Spell, the radius of the emanation increases by 5 feet up to a maximum of 30 feet.

Heightened (+2) Increase the mental damage by 1d4 and increase the radius of the initial emanation, the maximum radius, and the expansion when you Sustain the Spell by 5 feet.

Planar Breach.name: Planar Breach
Planar Breach.description:
The First World might have been a prototype, but one can always learn something from their predecessor. You tear open a temporary gateway to the First World, flooding the Material Plane with sensations it has long forgotten. Roll 1d8 on the table below to determine the effects of the area. If a creature is struck by multiple sensations, it uses the same d20 result for all its saving throws. For all effects, a successful saving throw negates the effect for that creature.

@Compendium[impossible-lands.impossible-lands-tables.LXurSpyHktYdWXe4]{Planar Breach}

Shades of Life.name: Shades of Life
Shades of Life.description:
The breadth of fey influence upon you can manifest in a variety of ways, temporarily morphing your own body. Choose one option below to gain its benefits. After picking an option, you cannot pick that one again until you have refocused.

  • Anteater – Your face and tongue elongate. You send your tongue out at a target within 30 feet with the effect of a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.MVrxZarUTnJxAUN8]{Tether} spell of a spell level 1 lower than the level of your druid focus spells. If your target fails, as long as they are within 30 feet, you can use your tongue to deliver touch range spells against them.
  • Cat Sith – Your body seems to turn shadowy and give off an unsettling aura. The next enemy you target within 1 minute with an effect that requires a saving throw must first make a @Check[will|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] against your spell DC. On a failure, they roll twice and take the lower result. This is a misfortune effect.
  • Cursed Bluebird – Blue bird wings are faintly visible, covering you as if a cloak. The first time during the duration that a creature hits you with a damaging attack or spell effect, they must first make a @Check[will|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] against your spell DC. On a failure, they take half the damage that you took, except it is force damage. On a critical failure, they take the full amount as force damage instead.
  • Dryad – Plant and wood life continuously grows on and around you. The area in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] around you is considered difficult terrain, and you are considered @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} to other creatures.
  • Faun – Your voice becomes melodious and induces fervor. Choose one ally within 30 feet that can hear you. They are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Quickened]{Quickened} for 1 round. During the duration, you can spend an Interact action to similarly quicken an ally that hasn't been targeted during the current casting. Allies can use the extra action to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Sneak]{Sneak}, Step, or Stride.
  • Gremlin – A large number of fey creatures surround you, waiting to do your bidding. You can send them to rapidly dig and burrow to create uneven ground in a @Template[burst|distance:5] within 30 feet. Any creature standing in, or walking over, the area must make a @Check[reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] against your spell DC. During the duration, you can spend an Interact action to command the fey critters to expand the area of the hole by an additional 5 feet, to a maximum size of a @Template[burst|distance:20].
  • Monarch – You grow great green, moth-like wings. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land speed for 1 minute. @UUID[Compendium.impossible-lands.impossible-lands-effects.XHP911Q1DxqXHE2o]{Effect: Shades of Life (Monarch)}
  • Unicorn – A small, shining horn protrudes from your head while the rest of your body sprouts a thin layer of impossibly soft white fur. During the duration, you can spend 1 Interact action to heal yourself or an adjacent ally for a number of [[/r (max(floor(@actor.level /2), 1)d6) + @abilities.wis.mod]]{d6 equal to half your level plus your spellcasting ability modifier}. The target also gains a +1 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration. @UUID[Compendium.impossible-lands.impossible-lands-effects.bybqUsSwEnpy4YH3]{Effect: Shades of Life (Unicorn)}

Spell Eater.name: Spell Eater
Spell Eater.description:
You've learned how to destabilize magic, harvesting it like the Spell Pitchers that pillage the wastes. You may attempt to counteract spells that would be cast or pass through the area by expending one of your spell slots as a reaction. You lose the chosen spell slot as if you had Cast the Spell. If you critically fail your counteract check against a spell, this spell immediately ends.

Heightened (+3) The range increases by 15 feet and the burst increases by 5 feet.
